text: hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with couscous primavera this is a
super easy super fast vegetable side
dish and yes i'm borrowing the name from
pasta primavera which just means spring
in italian and by the way very important
this is quick american-style couscous
not authentic north african couscous so
all you Moroccans just relax we are not
saying this is your authentic version
this is much better and of course when i
say much better i mean in the american
context of faster and easier all right
step one here we're going to measure our
dry couscous into a metal or glass bowl
all right something heat proof I'm gonna
add some diced jalapeno nice small dice
some green onion some cayenne a little
cumin a little black pepper and some
olive oil and what we're going to do is
we're going to take a spoon or fork and
mix that up and you want to keep mixing
keep mixing until every single little
tiny grain of couscous is coated with
oil by the way couscous is often
referred to as a grain it isn't actually
a little tiny grain it's more like
little tiny pieces of pasta so anyway
just a little extra info for you in case
you ever find yourself on a you know
side dish trivia related gameshow
alright once all the oil is mixed in
you're going to take a piece of foil big
enough to fit over your bowl and just
keep it ready keep it next to the bowl
you're going to need that alright we're
going to set that aside alright now
we're going to prep our other vegetables
and like I said earlier primavera means
spring so we're gonna use some nice
spring vegetables one being asparagus
I'm going to take a small bunch cut the
tips off and then cut the spears into
like small little quarter-inch pieces
I'm only going to cook this for like a
minute so we want it nice and small all
right so our asparagus is prepped over
on the stove I have a couple cups of
vegetable stock we're going to keep this
100% vegetarian but you can use chicken
stock I'm going to put that on high heat
I'm going to dump in some spring peas
you can use fresh or frozen I'm going to
dump in my asparagus and I'm going to
bring that to a boil so American style
couscous is super easy
it's couscous with boiling liquid poured
over it and then left to sit for a few
minutes so once that comes to a boil
you're going to quickly bring it over to
your couscous bowl you're going to pour
it in carefully and safely you're gonna
give the bowl a little shake to make
sure all the couscous is settled into
the liquid you're going to cover quickly
with your foil make a very tight seal
hurry hurry fast seal it tight there you
go that's going to sit for five minutes
now while that's sitting I'm gonna chop
some fresh herb I love mint in this
parsley works
basil works whatever your favorites are
any combination of herbs will work five
minutes later I'm going to take off the
foil take a fork and fluff up the
couscous and you're going to see how
beautifully it absorbed all that
flavorful liquid I'm going to season
with a little bit of salt which of
course I could have put in the stock and
then my fresh herb and this is ready to
serve what a fantastically easy side
dish now what makes this really cool
number one it's you know super fast and
easy but it's also good hot room
temperature and you can even serve this
cold with a little bit more olive oil
and maybe lemon juice or vinegar you
almost make like a salad out of it so
it's very versatile great for picnics
great for cookouts and there you go and
if you did it right all those little
grains of couscous will be totally
separate light fluffy delicious all
right you see all my beautiful green
spring vegetables the spring onions the
peas the asparagus jalapeno you know
give a little kick anything works in
this go to farmer's market get a bunch
of vegetables chop them up and make
vegetable couscous or as it's called
them the spring couscous Primavera
anyway I hope you give that a try all
the ingredients are on the site so go
check it out and as always enjoy
you
